      if (other.x < r) → no, because moving up r steps would take them below 0.

public static String solver(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> graph) {

    // Check if any robot is already at (0,0)
    for (ArrayList<Integer> pos : graph) {
        if (pos.get(0) == 0 && pos.get(1) == 0) {
            return "YES";
        }
    }

    // For each robot, check if it can be the target
    for (ArrayList<Integer> candidate : graph) {
        int r = candidate.get(0);
        int c = candidate.get(1);

        // Check all other robots
        boolean valid = true;
        for (ArrayList<Integer> other : graph) {
            if (other == candidate) continue; // skip itself
            int x = other.get(0);
            int y = other.get(1);
            if (x < r || y < c) {
                valid = false;
                break;
            }
        }
        if (valid) {
            return "YES";
        }
    }

    return "NO";
}
